areaSection: Altea, nestled on the Costa Blanca's northern coast, represents one of Spain's most refined coastal destinations. Perched on hillsides overlooking the Mediterranean, the town is celebrated for its whitewashed architecture, artistic heritage, and distinguished expat community. The geography provides natural elevation and privacy while remaining accessible to major amenities. Altea's temperate Mediterranean climate—with 300+ days of sunshine annually and mild winters—creates an ideal year-round living environment. The town has cultivated a cultural reputation attracting creative professionals, intellectuals, and affluent Europeans seeking authenticity beyond mass-tourism zones. Its strategic position between vibrant Benidorm and exclusive Calpe offers the perfect balance of sophisticated accessibility and serene isolation.
lifestyleSection: Life in Altea unfolds with a distinctly European sophistication. The town's artistic community—particularly strong among German, Scandinavian, and Dutch residents—creates a cosmopolitan cultural atmosphere with galleries, boutiques, and fine dining establishments throughout the historic quarter. Daily life balances Mediterranean leisure with metropolitan convenience: morning swims at Cap Negret or Playa de la Roda, afternoon markets featuring fresh Mediterranean produce, and evenings at waterfront restaurants serving world-class cuisine. The Thursday farmers' market brings seasonal abundance, while Tuesday's weekly market offers authentic local commerce. Healthcare standards exceed international expectations, with Hospital Marina Baixa providing comprehensive medical services within 10 minutes. For golf enthusiasts, world-class courses at Don Cayo, Villaitana, and La Sella sit within 25 minutes. The TRAM connection to Benidorm and Alicante ensures mobility without automobile dependency, while the expat community provides established social networks and English-language professional services.
investmentSection: This villa represents a compelling investment thesis within the appreciating Costa Blanca market. The property is competitively priced at the regional average, providing entry-point value in a market demonstrating consistent 6% year-on-year appreciation. Rental income potential reaches €1,100 per week during peak seasons, positioning this asset for favorable short-term returns while building long-term equity. Altea's reputation as a cultural destination attracts premium-paying renters seeking authentic Mediterranean experiences beyond commercialized beach resorts. The property's location in the established Alhama Springs community ensures consistent tenant quality and occupancy rates. Comparatively, this villa offers 25% greater value than similar properties in Mallorca, while maintaining equivalent quality and lifestyle amenities. For discerning investors balancing yield potential with capital appreciation and personal enjoyment, this property delivers exceptional versatility.

lifeAndAmenities.intro: Altea seamlessly blends Mediterranean leisure with cosmopolitan convenience. The town provides world-class healthcare, international education options, premium shopping, and sophisticated transport connections—all within minutes of your residence.

healthcare.text: Healthcare in Altea exceeds international standards, providing comprehensive medical services with English-speaking practitioners. Hospital Marina Baixa, located 10 minutes away, offers emergency departments, surgical facilities, and specialized care equivalent to northern European standards. Centro de Salud Altea provides primary care and diagnostics, while numerous private dental and medical clinics throughout town cater to expatriate populations. The healthcare infrastructure reflects Spain's position among Europe's highest-ranked medical systems, with advanced equipment and highly trained specialists. Prescription medications remain significantly less expensive than northern Europe, and comprehensive private health insurance is readily available.

education.text: Altea and surrounding areas provide diverse educational options meeting international standards. Colegio Español María Inmaculada offers Spanish curriculum with English instruction, while schools in nearby Benidorm and Calpe provide British, American, and other international curricula. Many families relocating to the region employ international schools catering to expatriate communities, with qualified educators and established university pathways. Educational standards rival central European institutions, with significantly reduced tuition compared to UK independent schools.

shopping.text: Daily shopping needs are seamlessly accommodated through premium supermarkets, local markets, and specialized retailers throughout Altea. Mercadona and Consum provide comprehensive grocery selections with Spanish and international products. The Tuesday weekly market remains an Altea institution, offering fresh produce, regional specialties, and artisanal products directly from local producers. This combination of modern retail and authentic Mediterranean market shopping ensures both convenience and cultural engagement.

transport.text: Altea's transportation infrastructure provides seamless connectivity without automobile dependency. The TRAM system connects directly to Benidorm (15 minutes) and extends to Alicante, enabling rail travel to Barcelona and Madrid. Bus networks serve local and regional destinations, while Alicante-Elche Airport, 55 minutes away, provides direct flights throughout Europe. The coastal highway provides quick access to neighboring communities. Many residents employ the tram for regular commuting while maintaining vehicles for discretionary use.

faqs.question: Kunnen buitenlanders eigendom kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes. Non-EU citizens may purchase property in Spain without residency requirements or ownership restrictions. The process requires NIE (Spanish tax identification number) acquisition and basic legal documentation. Most international buyers complete purchases within 4-8 weeks with qualified legal representation.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten om eigendom te kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs typically range 8-12% of property price, including: transfer tax (6-10%), notary fees (1%), registry fees (0.5-1%), and legal representation (1-2%). No stamp duty or VAT applies to resale properties. Spanish legal fees remain significantly lower than northern European equivalents.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten van levensonderhoud aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca offers exceptional value, with monthly living costs approximately 30-40% lower than northern Europe. Groceries, dining, utilities, and healthcare remain highly affordable. Property ownership costs, including community fees and local taxes, are minimal compared to UK or Scandinavian equivalents.

faqs.question: Kan ik als buitenlander een hypotheek krijgen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes. Most major Spanish banks provide mortgages to foreign buyers, typically covering 70-80% of property value. Interest rates remain competitive, and international financing documentation is routinely accepted. Property investment typically qualifies for favorable lending terms.

faqs.question: Is de Costa Blanca geschikt voor gepensioneerden?
faqs.answer: Yes. Costa Blanca is exceptionally popular with European retirees, offering year-round Mediterranean climate, world-class healthcare, low cost of living, and established expatriate communities. Altea specifically attracts affluent retirees seeking cultural engagement, artistic communities, and sophisticated amenities.
